means: 地方主义，地方偏狭观念

sentence.Network_en: He wanted to escape from the provincialism of the small university where he taught.
sentence.Network_cn: 他所执教是一所规模很小的大学,他想摆脱存在于其中的地方主义桎梏.

sentence.Network_en: A . Quebec's resistance to a national agency is provincialism ideology.
sentence.Network_cn: 魁北克对全国性机构的抵制是偏狭的思维方式.

sentence.Network_en: Three cups of Qinghuawu liquor conveys provincialism of all the life.
sentence.Network_cn: 三杯清华婺一世家乡情.

entry.tran: 地方主义；地方观念；偏狭
entry.def: Provincialism is the holding of old-fashioned attitudes and opinions, which some people think is typical of people in areas away from the capital city of a country.

example.tran: 巴克斯顿令人窒息的资产阶级狭隘观念

means.word_mean: 2. a partiality for some particular place

auth_sentence.content: To speak of reality becoming a spectacle is a breathtaking provincialism.
auth_sentence.res_content: To speak of reality becoming a spectacle is a breathtaking provincialism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To speak of reality becoming a spectacle is a breathtaking provincialism.

auth_sentence.content: "Provincialism loves the pseudo-epic," he has written, somewhat wryly.
auth_sentence.res_content: "Provincialism loves the pseudo-epic," he has written, somewhat wryly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "Provincialism loves the pseudo-epic," he has written, somewhat wryly.

auth_sentence.content: But the world is a very large place, and right now, your provincialism is showing.
